detailsOfAchievement: Presently we are conducting a free tuition and coaching centre for the school students belonging from the underprivileged section of the society. We also provide them books, exercise copies or exercise books, pen, pencils, eraser etc. for free just to make them interested in the studies. We have conducted free medical check up camps for the poor and needy people of the society. We have also conducted several programmes for the enthusiasms of children in the creative fields like music, art, drama etc. to encourage them to do what they love and also for the enrichment of the society. We have conducted anti child labor awareness camp to make the society understand that the basic duty of a child should be none other than education. We had organized environment awareness campaigns like tree plantation, tree distribution to the locals etc. We also visit nearer orphanages and old age homes several times, spend some time there and distribute sweets and several other foods to them. We also distribute chocolates several times to the childs of poor slum dwellers.

detailsOfAchievement: â€¢ This Association have member strength of 1470 Central Govt. pensioners /family pensioners as on 01.04.2016 comprising of 5 units. Monthly meetings in all 5 branches are held on scheduled date each month to enlighten members about latest development/circulars etc. issued by Govt. The governing Body of the Association, comprising of 25 members, meet on 2nd Monday of each month and discuss on various issues as per Agenda & take decision on the issues including passing of accounts for the month. The decision taken in the meeting are implemented after ratification in the GB Meeting of the following month. At the end of the calendar year, Annual General Meeting of the Association is held normally in the month of February when Audited Accounts of the Association are placed along with performances of the Association. Election of the Governing Body members is held bi-annually with prior notification to all members on roll. Besides the above, the following activities are also undertaken during the year: 1. Activities : i) Looking after the grievances of pensioners/family pensioners by taking up issues with the concerned departments/Banks for remedial action are the main function. In the previous year 262 grievances were taken up & 172 of them disposed of. The balance undecided 90 cases have been carried forward & tagged with the following year. ii) Social activities in the form of donation to Prime Minister Relief Fund for National calamities whenever necessary, Health check-up camp for pensioners/family pensioners, Awareness Programme on health such as cancer prevention etc., Cultural activities such as Library, Tourism (on no loss no profit basis) for pensioners with spouse/family pensioners. Cultural functions by members & local activists once a year after Durga Puja festival & on the occasion of Rabindra Jayanti (Tagoreâ€™s birth day) are held normally with monetary support from members. iii) In medical emergency/ daughterâ€™s marriage of members, on their written request are given assistance as advance on non-bearing interest, refundable in 12 months. iv) As a fast step towards Swachha Bharat Abhijan, the Governing Body members of the Association met together with a few enthusiasts on 15th & 22nd Mayâ€™ 2016 in the Association premises & took up the Swachhata drive in right earnestness & did their best for all round cleanliness of Association rooms & meeting hall etc. v) Every year, in the Annual General Meeting of the Association, octogenarian members are felicitated with Shawl etc. Last year we had felicitated 48 such octogenarian members. 2. Achievements : i) The Association was nominated as one of the Identified Associations in the year 2008 by the DOP&PW for representing grievances of pensioners. It also received annual grant of Rs. 60,000/- / 75,000/- to meet day to day expenses of the Association in four Identified heads. The work of the Association was further boosted by supply of a Computer & a printer by the Government. ii) The Association has also been nominated by DOP&PW as a rotational member in the Standing Council of Voluntary Agency (SCOVA) in 2015.

We did not apply for the grant because 3 years had not elapsed after registration of our trust. Though the trust was incorporated in 14-Mar-2012, we got it registered under ARA-III of Kolkata only on 30-Sep-2014. We were advised by experts to apply from the year 2017-18.

detailsOfAchievement: The Vibeknagar Initiative for Development and Emancipation (VIDE), a voluntary social service organization, completed its walk of long Ten years and has had experiences in the field of Womenâ€™s empowerment and Childrenâ€™sâ€™ development. The people who have been considered as socially excluded, vulnerable and marginalized are included as the beneficiaries of VIDE. The women and children are most oppressed and neglected in the poorer communities. Women in all communities are subjugated by in the male dominated society and they had to undertake all householdsâ€™ chores and the children are often skipping their right to childhood and deprive of education. During the last couple of years VIDE has been working for uplifting conditions of children (girls and women) and their mothers in the slums and squatters of Kolkata & different places of West Bengal. Education program for the squatter dwelling children has been organizing in the ward 91 and admitted those children into formal schools. Till day VIDE has mainstreamed 450 children and they have been continuing their education. In order to sensitize the parents of those children VIDE has been organizing awareness generation programs which enable them to take care of their offspring in proper manner. VIDE has been organizing 2 crÃ¨che centers in the KMC ward No 91 & 93 with the support from Central Social Welfare Board and West Bengal Social Welfare Advisory Board. In the three areas VIDE has organized three residential camps for Girls and women. First camp was for 30 days and the second camp was for 90 days and the third camp was for 120 days. This was funded by the department of Youth Affairs & Sports, Government of India. Besides, it has organized legal Awareness Camp for the woman which was funded by the National Commission for Women (NCW).VIDE also has organized one month non-residential camp on Health & Nutrition (Youth Activities And Training),funded by the Ministry of Youth Affairs & Sports, Govt. of India. Achievements out of undertaking the afore-mentioned programs are stated hereinafter: ï± 450 children have been admitted into formal schools; ï± The parents of the children have been participating in the Awareness Generation Camps from time to time that enabled them to take proper care of their children; ï± 150 adolescents girls have undergone training program in three spells one month and 3 months & 4 months on Care and Development of adolescents which include indoor sessions, dance, drama, drawing, exposure visits etc; ï± VIDE has been able to establish contact with the concerned government officials, local peoplesâ€™ representatives, local NGOs, CBOs and networking with the likeminded NGOs; ï± It has successfully organized cultural programs among the marginalized children which undoubtedly direct the children towards attaining humane values; ï± After all it can be said that VIDE is able to win confidence of the local people for undertaking the programs as stated above. People are having new test of life.

detailsOfAchievement: WAIA, as the organization is known, consists of a diverse group of members, who have come together with a common motive of creating an improved and better society. The organization thrives to motivate and educate the most deprived members of society through its various social awareness activities.Objectives of WAIA: - The members of WAIA strongly believe that society and its future can be greatly benefited by improving the adolescentsâ€™, education, health and social environment. The youth of today are the pillar of tomorrowâ€™s society and by providing a healthy and safe atmosphere, we, at WAIA can help to create a better world.WAIA Educate India Project- This educational based program targets both school and non-school going children. Under the Non-School Going category, children from very poor background and Our other mentoring program, which falls under the â€˜School Going Categoryâ€™, aims to assist school going children in preparing for subjects like Science, English and Math before their board exams. WAIA Educate India also focuses on providing healthcare to its students, who would be evaluated when joining the â€œEducate India Projectâ€ and during its term. This project is a â€œtime boundâ€ activity, with the sole purpose to take students a step forward in achieving their academic or educational goal. Under this project, WAIA aims at providing free education through mentoring, vocational training, computer training, distribution of books, providing free stationery and through sponsorship of both needful and academically excelling students. To create a positive environment, WAIA has organized mass awareness activities that focused on youth related issues like â€œAdolescent Awarenessâ€. We have been conducting quiz and debate competitions which primarily targeted the youth, who are the future of tomorrow. Another focus area of our NGO (non governmental organization) is in the primary healthcare sector where the members of WAIA intend to provide increased access to healthcare facilities. We plan to educate the masses about adopting prevention measures from contagious diseases like tuberculosis, seasonal diseases like malaria, diarrhea etc. This would be conducted during the free check up clinics organized for the needy. For this, we would be utilizing mobile medical units, which is basically a fully equipped ambulance that would handle patientsâ€™ needs. The mobile medical unit would be distributing free medicines, checking blood pressure and attending to the medical needs of the poor people of the community. By this we would be covering both the preventive and curative aspects of WAIAâ€™s health awareness ventures.

detailsOfAchievement: The objects for this trust is established are: (a) To establish, develop, maintain and grant aid in cash or in kind to hospitals, medical,schools, medical colleges, nursing institutions, dispensaries, maternity homes, child welfare centres and/or such other similar charitable institutions in India for the benefit and use of the general public. (b) To establish, run, support and grant aid or other financial assistance to schools,colleges, libraries, reading rooms, universities, laboratories, research and other institutions of the like nature in India, for use of the students and the staff and also for the development and advancement of education and diffusion of knowledge amongst the public in general. (c) To establish, maintain and run studentships, scholarships and render other kind of aid to students including supply of books, stipends, medals and other incentives to study, without any distinction as to caste, colour, race,creed or sex. (d) To promote, establish, support, maintain or grant aid to institutions for the promotion of science, literature, music, drama and fine arts,for the preservation of historical monuments and for the research and other institutions, in India, having similar objects for the benefit of the public in general. (e) To establish, maintain or grant aid for the establishment and/or maintenance of parks, gardens, gymnasiums, sports clubs, dharamshalas and rest houses, for use by public in general. (f) To establish, maintain or grant aid to homes for the aged, orphanages or other establishments for the relief and help to the poor, needy and destitute people, orphans, widows and aged persons. (g) To establish and develop institutions for the physically handicapped and disabled or mentally retarded persons and to provide them education, food, clothing or other help. (h) To grant relief and assistance to the needy victims during natural calamities such as famine, earth quake, flood, fire, pestilence, etc.and to give donations and other assistance to institutions, establishments or persons engaged in such relief work.

detailsOfAchievement: West Bengal Voluntary Health Association (WBVHA) is a state-level health care NGO network to reach primary health care and family welfare services to the poorest section of the people who are underprivileged and in distressed condition. WBVHA works through local grass-root level NGOs with active involvement and participation of community at large. Starting from 8th July, 1974, WBVHA has gained its experience of more than four decades.

detailsOfAchievement: Education: Pre-primary education and coaching support in the red light areas covering 1483 beneficiaries. A holistic education programme for street children, which includes non-formal education, mainstreaming and coaching for 650 children in 15 Police Stations. Nutrition: Supplementary nutrition provided to all children attending the education centres. Anti Trafficking Network: Secretariat ATSEC West Bengal, working on prevention of trafficking and sexual abuse of women and children in 9 districts. Prevention of cross border trafficking in women and children, between West Bengal, India and Bangladesh. Developing rights based approach against anti trafficking actions in South Asia: Awareness generation; Capacity building of government officials, elected representatives, law enforcement agencies, law school students and high school students; Rescue; Rehabilitation; Reintegration and Repatriation of trafficked victims. Child Protection: 3 shelter homes, integrated institutional complex for 225 girl children from red light areas, lost, abandoned and girl children at risk, trafficking survivors and street children. Vocational training and Income generation programmes: Organising urban and rural women for skill development and income generation activities, such as - formation of SHGs, skill training, marketing, facilitating in opening Bank accounts and accessing loans. HIV-AIDS: In 2 districts the activities include awareness, male and female condom promotion, counselling, referral service and stigma removal of HIV positive. Integrated Water, Health, Hygiene and Sanitation: Construction of toilets in red light areas, villages, municipalities, low cost house hold latrines, sinking hand pumps, promoting stand post, health education and diarrhoea prevention. Adopt a Granny: with aged women in prostitution in red light areas are cared for with monthly sponsorship. Endogenous Rural Tourism: To bring about improvement in the livelihood pattern and development of the tribal community, particularly women through group formation, training and capacity building, promotion of their art and culture, handicrafts. Legal Aid for Women: Government approved service provider under the PWDV Act 2005. Providing training to Protection Officers and Police. Alternative Source of Energy: Setting up of Solar light in a village.
